what: Tumor growth data for a breast cancer model — breast
title: Tumor growth data for a breast cancer model — breast
text: strain rat, tumors begin appear 6 weeks carcinogen followed another 6 weeks. goal study estimate effects nicotinamide riboside (dietary supplement) growth mammary gland tumors.

title: Tumor growth data for a breast cancer model — breast
Tumor growth data for a breast cancer model — breast
text: data frame 336 rows 6 variables: ID Mouse identifier indicate repeated measurements mouse. (factor) Cohort Indicator cohort mouse belonged , order account potential batch effects. (factor) Treatment Treatment group (factor). VEH = control (vehicle), NR = nicotinamide riboside Week Week measurment (integer) Volume Tumor volume, cubic mm (double) Number Number tumors (integer)

title: Tumor growth data for a breast cancer model — breast
text: University Iowa, Holden Cancer Center, experiment PJB17-025.

what: Generate tumor data: Time to reach endpoint — gendat
title: Generate tumor data: Time to reach endpoint — gendat
text: Generate tumor data: Time reach endpoint

title: Generate tumor data: Time to reach endpoint — gendat
Generate tumor data: Time to reach endpoint — gendat
text: n Number mice per group effect_size Vector effect sizes, growth ratio (default: 2) m Number measurements per mouse (default: 3) alpha Shape parameter gamma distribution (default: 9) sd Noise (standard deviation, default: 100)

title: Generate tumor data: Time to reach endpoint — gendat
text: Y            Observed measurements M            Idealized 'true' size mouse time (error) B            'True' growth rate mouse (data-generating mechanism)

title: Generate tumor data: Time to reach endpoint — gendat
code: Data <- gendat(5, effect_size=2, m=6) matplot(Data$time, t(Data$Y[,,1]), lty=1, type='l', col='#FF4E37', bty='n', las=1,         ylab=expression("Tumor volume "*(mm^3)), xlab='Day') matplot(Data$time, t(Data$Y[,,2]), lty=1, type='l', col='#008DFF', add=TRUE)

title: Linear Mixed Model for Tumor Growth Data — lmm
text: data tumor growth data tumr_obj takes tumr_obj created tumr() formula linear mixed model formula id Column subject ID's time Column repeated time measurements measure Column repeated measurements tumor group Column specifying treatment group measurement

title: Linear Mixed Model for Tumor Growth Data — lmm
text: summary linear mixed model fit

title: Linear Mixed Model for Tumor Growth Data — lmm
code: data(melanoma1) meta_data <- tumr(ID, Day, Volume, Treatment) lmm( data = melanoma1, tumr_obj = meta_data ) #> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod'] #> Formula: Volume ~ Treatment + Day + (1 | ID) #>    Data: data #>  #> REML criterion at convergence: 8740.8 #>  #> Scaled residuals:  #>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max  #> -1.4990 -0.5199 -0.1879  0.2711  7.0893  #>  #> Random effects: #>  Groups   Name        Variance Std.Dev. #>  ID       (Intercept)  18139   134.7    #>  Residual             124734   353.2    #> Number of obs: 600, groups:  ID, 35 #>  #> Fixed effects: #>              Estimate Std. Error t value #> (Intercept)  456.2534    58.8662   7.751 #> TreatmentB  -524.8697    78.3362  -6.700 #> TreatmentC  -148.6094    81.2940  -1.828 #> TreatmentD  -681.5280    80.3381  -8.483 #> Day            3.7457     0.4345   8.621 #>  #> Correlation of Fixed Effects: #>            (Intr) TrtmnB TrtmnC TrtmnD #> TreatmentB -0.681                      #> TreatmentC -0.687  0.523               #> TreatmentD -0.659  0.558  0.510        #> Day        -0.213 -0.170 -0.019 -0.192  lmm( data = melanoma2, tumr_obj = meta_data, formula = "Volume ~ Day + (1 | ID)" ) #> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod'] #> Formula: Volume ~ Day + (1 | ID) #>    Data: data #>  #> REML criterion at convergence: 8271.4 #>  #> Scaled residuals:  #>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max  #> -2.4943 -0.5851 -0.1894  0.3945  3.1729  #>  #> Random effects: #>  Groups   Name        Variance Std.Dev. #>  ID       (Intercept)  77726   278.8    #>  Residual             104816   323.8    #> Number of obs: 568, groups:  ID, 47 #>  #> Fixed effects: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value #> (Intercept) 150.8564    47.2411   3.193 #> Day          11.5321     0.6492  17.765 #>  #> Correlation of Fixed Effects: #>     (Intr) #> Day -0.408  data(breast) lmm( data = breast, id = "ID", group = "Treatment", time = "Week", measure = "Volume" ) #> Linear mixed model fit by REML ['lmerMod'] #> Formula: Volume ~ Treatment + Week + (1 | ID) #>    Data: data #>  #> REML criterion at convergence: 6939.5 #>  #> Scaled residuals:  #>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max  #> -1.9538 -0.4906 -0.1252  0.2558 10.3047  #>  #> Random effects: #>  Groups   Name        Variance  Std.Dev. #>  ID       (Intercept)  48183630  6941    #>  Residual             169051234 13002    #> Number of obs: 319, groups:  ID, 28 #>  #> Fixed effects: #>              Estimate Std. Error t value #> (Intercept)  -6047.95    2527.58  -2.393 #> TreatmentVEH    35.49    3003.37   0.012 #> Week          1909.65     218.96   8.722 #>  #> Correlation of Fixed Effects: #>             (Intr) TrtVEH #> TreatmntVEH -0.598        #> Week        -0.545  0.012

title: Plot of tumor growth over time using the median — plot_median
code: data(breast) plot_median( data = breast, group = "Treatment", time = "Week", measure = "Volume", id = "ID", type = "conf_int" )  data(melanoma1) meta_data <- tumr(ID, Day, Volume, Treatment) plot_median( data = melanoma1, tumr_obj = meta_data )  plot_median( data = melanoma1, group = "Treatment", time = "Day", measure = "Volume", id = "ID", type = "conf_int" )  data(melanoma2) plot_median( data = melanoma2, group = "Treatment", time = "Day", measure = "Volume", id = "ID" )  data(prostate) plot_median( data = prostate, group = "Genotype", time = "Age", measure = "BLI", id = "ID" )

what: Tumor growth data for a prostate cancer model — prostate
title: Tumor growth data for a prostate cancer model — prostate
text: experiment, 49 mice split 3 groups. groups Pten, cancer gene, knocked prostates. One group normal p53, one group one copy p53 knocked , third group copies p53 knocked prostates. mice also bioluminescent reporter tumor progression monitored imaging.

title: Tumor growth data for a prostate cancer model — prostate
Tumor growth data for a prostate cancer model — prostate
text: data frame 336 rows 6 variables: ID Mouse identifier indicate repeated measurements mouse. (factor) Age Age mouse, weeks (integer) BLI Tumor volume, measured bioluminescent imaging, photons (double) Genotype p53 genotype (factor). WT = wild type, HET = single knockout, DOKO = double knockout.
